Buy Bitcoin with PayPal

Because PayPal is the most common way to pay online many people want to buy bitcoin with PayPal. But PayPal payments are reversible, while Bitcoin transactions are not. This makes it risky for dealers and exchanges to accept PayPal for Bitcoin.

However, it's still possible to buy bitcoin with PayPal although it often comes with high fees or a large premium. The list below features companies, brokers, or escrow services that let you buy bitcoin with PayPal or match you with a local seller who accepts PayPal.

VirWoX Buy Bitcoin

VirWoX stands for Virtual World Exchange, and mainly serves as a way for people to buy Second Life Lindens, a currency used in the virtual world Second Life. You can't buy Bitcoin with PayPal directly at VirWoX, but it's possible to first buy Second Life Lindens (SLL) and then trade your SLL for Bitcoin. This process works perfectly, but in the end will cost you about 7% in fees.

Local Bitcoins Buy Bitcoin

Local Bitcoins connects you with local sellers who accept PayPal for Bitcoin. It's best to meet the seller in person and make the transaction in order to reduce the risk of fraud. Only deal with Local Bitcoins sellers with good feedback and a history of sales.

bitcoin-otc Buy Bitcoin

It may be possible to buy bitcoin with PayPal using bitcoin-otc. However, this depends on the order book and if someone is currently willing to sell their Bitcoin for PayPal. It may not be possible to use bitcoin-otc in some countries, and the amount of sellers who accept PayPal is very small.

There will likely never be an easy, straight forward way to buy bitcoin with PayPal due to the irreversible nature of Bitcoin transactions.

If you can, transfer your PayPal funds to your bank and buy via bank transfer. Or, transfer your PayPal funds to your bank, withdrawal as cash, and buy bitcoin with cash deposit.
